text: Does github API give you just the number of contributors or also name/email?

elements.text: Does github API give you just the number of contributors or also name/email?

text:
name + github id + a bunch of URLs, but not email. You can try it with:
```curl \
  -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" \
  <https://api.github.com/repos/julialang/julia/contributors>```
 you get a list of objects back, one per contributer

elements.text: name + github id + a bunch of URLs, but not email. You can try it with:

you get a list of objects back, one per contributer

text:
```julia> results=GitHub.contributors(GitHub.repo("JuliaLang/julia"; auth=auth); auth=auth);

julia> typeof(results)
Tuple{Vector{Dict{String, Any}}, Dict{String, String}}

julia> results[2]
Dict{String, String} with 2 entries:
  "prev"  => "<https://api.github.com/repositories/1644196/contributors?page=13>"
  "first" => "<https://api.github.com/repositories/1644196/contributors?page=1>"```
so I don’t see a “next”, so I think that means it gave us all the pages it has?

text:
```julia% git shortlog --summary --email --no-merges --numbered|wc -l  
1346```
would confirm the ~1k contributors, but there are tons of duplicates (Viral appears three times, despite deduplicating some entries in `.mailmap`, he needs to add some more addresses)

text:
<https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#list-repository-contributors|https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#list-repository-contributors>

> To improve performance, only the first 500 author email addresses in the repository link to GitHub users. The rest will appear as anonymous contributors without associated GitHub user information.
> 
This may explain why for JuliaLang/julia we only get 404 contributors

elements.text: https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/repos#list-repository-contributors
To improve performance, only the first 500 author email addresses in the repository link to GitHub users. The rest will appear as anonymous contributors without associated GitHub user information.
This may explain why for JuliaLang/julia we only get 404 contributors

text:
Uhm, ok, I guess we can ignore the issue for the time being as we don't have repositories with that many contributors. Using the git history has a couple of drawbacks:
• We need the full history, right now we clone only the tip :joy:
• We have lots of duplicates and no one uses mailmap

text:
There’s this parameter 
> anon	string	query	
> Set to 1 or true to include anonymous contributors in results.
should we set that? Maybe we can get total contributers per repo that way even for big ones like Julia base

text:
Hm, with `anon=true` we get 1277 responses for JuliaLang/julia; 873 are of anonymous type, but they aren’t all grouped up together as one entry. For example, I’m one of them and my response is
```julia> [ r for r in res[1] if r["contributor"].name == "Eric Hanson"]
1-element Vector{Dict{String, Any}}:
 Dict("contributor" => Owner (all fields are Union{Nothing, T}):
  typ: "Anonymous"
  email: "<mailto:5846501+ericphanson@users.noreply.github.com|5846501+ericphanson@users.noreply.github.com>"
  name: "Eric Hanson", "contributions" => 2)```
so we at least get a name and email still, just not the association with the github identity.

elements.text: Hm, with `anon=true` we get 1277 responses for JuliaLang/julia; 873 are of anonymous type, but they aren’t all grouped up together as one entry. For example, I’m one of them and my response is

julia> [ r for r in res[1] if r["contributor"].name == "Eric Hanson"]
1-element Vector{Dict{String, Any}}:
 Dict("contributor" => Owner (all fields are Union{Nothing, T}):
  typ: "Anonymous"
  email: "5846501+ericphanson@users.noreply.github.com"
  name: "Eric Hanson", "contributions" => 2)
so we at least get a name and email still, just not the association with the github identity.
